openai.title: Artificial intelligence in teaching
openai.infoBoxText:
[Artificial intelligence in teaching]( https://teaching.helsinki.fi/instructions/article/artificial-intelligence-teaching) is currently a relevant topic. Curre provides you with the opportunity to try out [OpenAIs](https://openai.com/) ChatGPT language model and explore ways it could support your teaching. It is important to note that these suggestions may contain factual errors and that they are part of Curre, namely so that every teacher at the University of Helsinki would have the opportunity to familiarize themselves with the current topic through experimentation.

There are two methods available to ask the artificial intelligence questions related to your teaching. Either through the open text field, providing the course title and see what kind of lecture titles the artificial intelligence suggests for your course. Or by choosing one of the learning modes, you have selected in Curre, the artificial intelligence will then suggest different ways to use the software in order to support the given learning mode throughout the course. 

The Study Affairs Council at the University of Helsinki has published [Guidelines for the use of artificial intelligence at the University of Helsinki](https://teaching.helsinki.fi/system/files/inline-files/tekoalylinjaukset_Helsingin_yliopiston_opetuksessa_0.pdf) on 16 February 2023. [Global Campus](https://blogs.helsinki.fi/globalcampus/) researches and develops different ways of using ChatGPT. If the topic interests you, you can also directly contact [the Global Campus project](https://blogs.helsinki.fi/globalcampus/contact-us/).
openai.giveCourseInfoText: If you would like lecture ideas for your course, enter the course name below
openai.courseInfoText: If you want lecture ideas for your course, press the send-button.
openai.courseCompletionPrompt: Enter 5 lecture topics for a course with the title "{{courseName}}".
openai.selectDimensionInfoText: For ideas on how to use the tools, select the dimension to support
openai.dimensionCompletionPrompt: How can I support the topic "{{dimensionName}}" in a university course? Give 3 examples using the software {{recommendations}}?
